eecs.jago.element
Class MobileElement

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--eecs.jago.element.SimElement
        |
        +--eecs.jago.element.VisibleElement
              |
              +--eecs.jago.element.MobileElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
Collidable, Mobile, java.lang.Runnable, Visible
Direct Known Subclasses:
Barrel, FloorButton, JavaBall, PushableBox, StandardRobot, StandardSensor
public abstract class MobileElement
extends VisibleElement
implements Collidable, Mobile

This class provides a skeletal implementation of an element that implements the Collidable, Mobile, and Visible interfaces.

To implement a mobile element, the user needs only to extend this class and provide a method that implements handleCollision. The other abstract methods are optional to allow extended functionality.

The motion of elements is replicated at scale values when in realistic mode. In the simulation, this means that using the simulation default scaling (see SimEngine), any class based on a MobileElement must ensure that the value for power is set to m/s. The position management of the MobileElement will manage the adjustment due to scale, but assumes that the power settings are m/s. If the updatePosition method is overridden, ensure you account for this assumption.

pendingCollision

protected boolean pendingCollision
If the element is currently being checked for a possible collision

power

protected double power
The current power of this MobileElement, in m/s. Increasing the power will only be visible when the MobileElement is moving (power does not cause the MobileElement to move), since power is the capability, not the actual movement.

previousLocation

protected java.awt.geom.Point2D previousLocation
The last valid location of the MobileElement

previousShape

protected java.awt.geom.Area previousShape
The Area of this MobileElement during the last successful draw

protected PolarPoint previousVel
The previous velocity vector for this element.

propulsionDevice

protected java.util.ArrayList propulsionDevice

rightWheel

protected Propulsion rightWheel

timeLeftToMove

protected int timeLeftToMove
The amount of time (in ms) that this MobileElement still must move. This field is used to prevent a MobileElement from moving farther than directed, based on thread timing.

velVector

protected PolarPoint velVector
The current velocity vector for this element

setInitialHeading

public int setInitialHeading(int heading)
Sets the initial heading (in degrees) of the MobileElement. If successful, this method returns the heading. Heading requests less than 0 or greater than 360 are accepted. If the robot has been added to a simulation, moved, or the heading was already set, this method denies the request.

Parameters:
heading - The requested heading
Returns:
the new heading of the robot (value 0-360). Return -1 if the heading was already set (so the request fails)

setPower

public void setPower(double level)
Sets the new power of the mobile element, in m/s. Power is the potential velocity of the element, not the instantaneous velocity.

Specified by:
setPower in interface Mobile
Parameters:
level - DOCUMENT ME!

addedTo

public void addedTo(SimEngine sim,
                    java.awt.geom.Point2D loc)
Notifies this MobileElement that it was added to the specified SimEngine at the location given. Once it has been added, the initial heading is fixed (calls to setInitialHeading will be ignored). This method is only called by the SimEngine that is acknowledging addition of this element.

Overrides:
addedTo in class SimElement
Parameters:
sim - The SimEngine where this element was added
loc - The location in the SimEngine where it was added

updatePosition

public void updatePosition()
Updates the current location based on velocity and heading. This method will ensure the mobile object does not move more than the time specified in its move methods as long as timeLeftToMove is set to the amount of time to move.

For example, if the element has a method declared as:


public void move(int milliseconds)

then the move method should set

timeLeftToMove = milliseconds

Specified by:
updatePosition in interface Mobile

createArea

createArea in class SimElement

runTaskStep

protected void runTaskStep()
Perform one step of execution of this element

Overrides:
runTaskStep in class SimElement

updateVelocity

protected void updateVelocity()
Determines the new velocity of the mobile element. Classes derived from a MobileElement must provide their own functionality, as this class does not provide any implementation.
